meanings.sent1: The cake was a whole cake, not missing any slices.
meanings.sent2: She felt whole again after reuniting with her family.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was missing a piece, so it wasn't a whole picture.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt whole when he was with her, like nothing was missing.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together as a whole unit to win the game.

meanings.definition: Not divided or broken; in one piece
meanings.sent1: The vase remained whole even after it fell off the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The whole cookie stayed intact despite being dropped.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fix the broken toy, but it never looked whole again.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt whole when she held the unbroken necklace.
meanings.sent5: The whole mirror reflected her unbroken smile back at her.

meanings.sent1: She ate the whole pizza by herself in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: He read the whole book in just one night.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the whole stack of papers in one swift move.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed in the whole garden, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The students cleaned the whole classroom together before the bell rang.
